net.informaticalibera.videoediting

Interface VideoEditingNativeInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.codename1.system.NativeInterface
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public interface VideoEditingNativeInterface
extends com.codename1.system.NativeInterface

    This native interface is deprecated because you shouldn't use it directly.

    This native interface provides methods to get some info of the video placed in the FileSystemStorage and to optimize them for fast uploading to a server.

    About the video compression, it relies on MobileFFmpeg on Android and on AVAssetExportSession on iOS.

    • Method Summary

      Deprecated.

      Deprecated. 
      Returns the duration of the videoFile in seconds, or -1 in case of error
      java.lang.String getVideoSize(java.lang.String videoFile)
      Deprecated. 
      Returns the size of the given video in the format widthxheight, for example 1280x720
      void optimizeVideoForUpload(java.lang.String inputVideoFile, java.lang.String outputVideoFile)
      Deprecated. 
      (Async) method to optimize the given inputVideoFile for fast uploading.Currently it uses a default low quality both on Android and iOS.

      • getImageFromVideo

        void getImageFromVideo(java.lang.String videoFile,
                       java.lang.String jpegFile)
        Deprecated. 
        Extract the first frame from the given video file and saves it to the given jpeg file.
        Parameters:
        videoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix
        jpegFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix

      • getVideoDuration

        long getVideoDuration(java.lang.String videoFile)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the duration of the videoFile in seconds, or -1 in case of error
        Parameters:
        videoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix
        Returns:
        duration is seconds (or -1 in case of error)

      • getVideoBitrate

        int getVideoBitrate(java.lang.String videoFile)
        Deprecated. 
        Get the average bitrate (in bits/sec), if available.
        Parameters:
        videoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix
        Returns:
        average bitrate (in bits/sec), if available (or -1 in case of error).

      • getVideoSize

        java.lang.String getVideoSize(java.lang.String videoFile)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the size of the given video in the format widthxheight, for example 1280x720
        Parameters:
        videoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix
        Returns:
        the size of the video (or null in case of error)

      • optimizeVideoForUpload

        void optimizeVideoForUpload(java.lang.String inputVideoFile,
                            java.lang.String outputVideoFile)
        Deprecated. 
        (Async) method to optimize the given inputVideoFile for fast uploading.Currently it uses a default low quality both on Android and iOS.
        Parameters:
        inputVideoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix
        outputVideoFile - FileSystemStorage path, make sure doesn't include the "file:" prefix (the file name defaults to "optimized.mp4")
